page.title: 07JEWISH COMMUNITIES
page.content: There are two Jewish Communities in Bournemouth, the Reform and Orthodox. The Orthodox has about 800 members and the Reform about 400 members. The Orthodox which I belong to is three quarters retired people, the rest are aged 30 and under. The Reform is mainly made up of young people as it does not keep all the customs the Orthodox carries out, ie not driving to the synagogue on shabbat or keep separate pots for meat and milk dishes. Another custom of the orthodox is that the men and women do not sit together in the synagogue and the Reformists do not carry this out. There are two Jewish cemetries,one at Kinson and one at Moordown. There is a Jewish home called the Hannah Levy home which houses about fifteen people and one for the blind called the Dolly Ross home. A. DAVIDSON.
